text: Olé is a Latin music studio album by Johnny Mathis. It was released in November 1964 through Mercury Records and is the non-holiday themed since Mathis's first studio album release in 1956. It did not chart at all in the Billboard 200. ==Track listing== ===Side one=== #"Granada" (Agustín Lara) – 3:11 #"Without You (Tres Palabras)" (Osvaldo Farrés, Ray Gilbert) – 2:45 #Medley – 4:20 a. "Generique" (Antônio Carlos Jobim, Vinicius de Moraes) b. "Felicidade" (Antônio Carlos Jobim, Vinicius de Moraes) #"Manhã de Carnaval (Morning of the Carnival)" from "Orfeu Negro (Black Orpheus)" (Luiz Bonfá) – 3:12 #"Samba de Orfeu" from "Orfeu Negro (Black Orpheus)" (Luiz Bonfá, Antônio Maria) – 2:23 ===Side two=== #"La Montaña" (Augusto Algueró) – 3:35 #"Babalu" (Margarita Lecuana, Bob Russell) – 2:45 #"Serenata" (Leroy Anderson, Mitchell Parish) – 3:37 #"Bachianas Brasileiras, Pts. 1–3" (Heitor Villa-Lobos) – 7:01 ==References== Category:1964 albums Category:Johnny Mathis albums Category:Mercury Records albums
title: Olé (Johnny Mathis album)
